title: Guatemala seeks arrest of ex-guerrilla leader in 1980 blast
description: A judge in Guatemala has issued an arrest warrant for Gustavo Meoño, a former leftist guerrilla leader and transparency activist, in connection with a 1980 bomb attack

title: Greek authorities rescue 39 migrants dumped on border islet
description: Greek authorities say they have rescued a group of 39 migrants abandoned by smugglers on an islet in the river that runs along the country’s land border with Turkey

title: Mexico develops own COVID-19 vaccine, 2 years late
description: Mexican officials are crowing about the country finally developing its own COVID-19 vaccine, more than two years after inoculations from the U.S., Europe and China were rolled out

title: Real or not, reported Kremlin drone attack unsettles Russia
description: A cloud of questions hangs over Russia’s claim that two Ukrainian drones flew into the very heart of Moscow under the cover of darkness, reaching the Kremlin before they were shot down at the last minute

title: Canadian man charged with counseling suicides in 2 deaths
description: Police in Canada have arrested a man for allegedly selling a lethal substance to people at risk of self-harm and charged him with counseling suicide in the deaths of two Canadians

title: Mexico president complains US is funding opposition
description: Mexico President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has again complained to the United States that the U.S. government is funding organizations opposed to his administration, this time in a letter to President Joe Biden

title: Ukraine’s military is stronger than U.S. leaks indicated, Blinken says
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said he was "confident" Ukraine's counteroffensive would yield some success in regaining Russian-occupied territory.

title: Pompeii chariot stars in Rome exhibit probing ancient roots
description: A reconstructed Pompeii bridal chariot that eluded modern-day thieves in the ancient city is a star of a new exhibition in Rome

title: Rights panel: Peru used excessive force to quell protests
description: The Inter American Commission on Human Rights says Peru’s military and police forces used excessive force to quell violent anti-government protests, and that they should be investigated as possible extrajudicial executions and massacres

title: Berlin police say 2 girls seriously wounded in school attack
description: Berlin police say two young children were seriously wounded in an attack at a school in the south of the capital

title: Sudan’s warring generals closely matched ahead of latest cease-fire
description: The military and the RSF have divided up Sudan's towns, factories and resources between them as neither side appears to have the immediate upper hand.

title: Juan Guaidó says he felt U.S. pressure to get on plane to Miami
description: The Venezuelan opposition leader appeared in Bogotá last week hoping to attend an international summit. Instead, he told The Washington Post, he felt pressured to leave by U.S. and Colombian officials.

title: Report: Taliban interfering with NGO work in Afghanistan
description: A U.S. report says a Taliban fighter fired his rifle into the air during a food distribution event recently in Afghanistan, citing it as an example of their harassment of nongovernmental groups working in the country

title: Bolsonaro’s vaccine status forged before entering U.S., police say
description: Bolsonaro, a longtime skeptic of the coronavirus vaccines, has repeatedly said he would not be vaccinated: "Let me die."

title: Belizeans question the role of the British monarchy ahead of coronation
description: The Central American nation is a British commonwealth realm with King Charles III as its monarch and head of state.

title: US military says it targeted senior al-Qaida leader in Syria
description: The U.S. military says it has carried out a drone strike in northwestern Syria targeting a senior al-Qaida leader

title: Ancient Knights of Malta gets its first nonaristocratic head
description: A Canadian lawyer who found his vocation caring for AIDS patients in Harlem has been elected the grand master of the Knights of Malta

title: Fossils or not? Nations split on how to meet climate goals
description: Senior officials from dozens of nations meeting in Berlin remain divided on how to meet international climate goals

title: UN humanitarian chief in Sudan, seeking guarantees on aid
description: The U.N.’s humanitarian chief has arrived in Sudan’s main seaport, as thousands of Sudanese and foreign nationals gather there, hoping to flee the conflict-torn east African country

title: King Charles III: Memorable quotes from his decades as an outspoken royal
description: Before becoming king, Charles shared his views on topics from "monstrous carbuncle" architecture to the "headless chicken brigade" of climate deniers.

title: Swiss lower house approves closer ties to Taiwan legislature
description: Switzerland’s lower house of parliament has voted to tighten ties with the legislature in Taiwan, a move that could further rankle China after recent visits by Western lawmakers to the island

title: These people want to flee Sudan. Their passports are locked in empty embassies.
description: Some Sudanese are trapped in the country with their passports in the custody of embassies that evacuated staff without returning travel documents.

title: Severe flooding in Italy kills 2; drought persists
description: Heavy rains have caused flooding in Italy’s populous Emilia-Romagna region, leaving at least two people dead as riverbeds left dry by drought overflowed their banks after a day and a half of non-stop rain

title: Turkey closes airspace to Armenian flights over monument
description: Turkey’s foreign minister says his country has closed its airspace to Armenian aircraft, in retaliation for the erection of a monument in the Armenian capital, Yerevan

title: Kremlin says Ukraine sent two drones to attack Vladimir Putin
description: Moscow said that two drones attempted to attack the Russian president's residence at the Kremlin in Moscow but that he was not in the building at the time. The claim could not be verified.

title: In Photos: The scene after 8 children and 1 guard were killed in a school shooting in Serbia
description: Eight children and a security guard were killed after a seventh grade student opened fire at a school in the Serbian capital of Belgrade on Wednesday morning, authorities said.

title: UN denounces Taliban intimidation, attacks on Afghan media
description: The United Nations says the Taliban’s intimidation, threats and attacks on Afghan journalists are unacceptable

title: Autopsies find some victims of Kenya starvation cult were suffocated
description: At least 110 bodies have been exhumed so far, as authorities investigate what appears to be a religious cult that preached starvation to its members.

title: Germany: School evacuated over suspected gas exposure
description: Exposure to a suspected irritant gas has affected at least 70 people at a school in southwestern Germany, according to a media report

title: 12 die in explosion, helicopter crash during Chinese holiday
description: At least nine people were killed in an explosion at a Chinese petrochemical plant and three others died in a helicopter crash during the country’s May Day holiday

title: Turkish singer sentenced over joke on religious schools
description: A Turkish court has given pop singer Gulsen a 10-month suspended sentence after convicting her of “inciting hatred and enmity” over a joke about Turkey’s religious schools

title: 8 children, 1 guard killed in rare school shooting in Serbia
description: Officials said a seventh grader suspected of opening fire at a Belgrade school was arrested. Authorities said six children and a teacher were also injured.

title: Dissident pulled off plane by Belarus gets 8 years in prison
description: A Belarusian court has convicted a dissident journalist who was arrested after being pulled off a commercial flight that was diverted to the country

title: Fire rages at Russian oil depot; Zelenskyy visits Finland
description: Officials say a massive blaze has broken out at a Russian oil depot

title: Courtiers make life for Britain’s royals possible — and for some miserable
description: The Washington Post sat down for a talk with Britain's premier chronicler of court life, Valentine Low about what goes on behind the scenes of royal life.

title: Israel-Gaza hostilities new test Netanyahu’s hard-right government
description: An internationally-brokered cease-fire is holding for now, but several hard-right members of the government have pushed for harsher measures in the face of Gaza rocket attacks.

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy in Finland for summit of Nordic leaders
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is in the Finnish capital, Helsinki, for a one-day Nordic summit

title: US Navy: Iran seizes oil tanker in Strait of Hormuz
description: Iran seized a Panama-flagged oil tanker in the Strait of Hormuz on Wednesday, the second-such capture by Tehran in recent days

title: Pope greets Russian Orthodox envoy amid peace mission talk
description: Pope Francis has greeted the foreign envoy of the Russian Orthodox Church at the Vatican

title: Palace weapons arrest comes amid coronations security push
description: Britain’s security minister says the coronation of King Charles III involves one of the most important security operations in U.K. history

title: One of the world’s priciest cities raises minimum wage – to $5
description: Hong Kong labor groups said the first wage raise in four years wasn't enough in a city with famously expensive and cramped housing.

title: Teenage boy opens fire in school in Serbian capital
description: Serbian police say that a teenage boy has opened fire in a school in central Belgrade, causing injuries

title: Priest, scientist on trial in Germany over climate protest
description: A Jesuit priest and a scientist are appearing before a court in Munich charged with coercion in connection with a climate protest last year

title: Iran's president lands in Syria for rare meeting with Assad
description: Iran’s president has landed in Damascus on the first visit by an Iranian head of state to war-wracked Syria since Tehran helped tip the balance of power there to the government

title: UN: 258 million people faced acute food insecurity in 2022
description: A report says more than a quarter-billion people in 58 countries faced acute food insecurity last year

title: French constitutional body rules on pension referendum call
description: France’s top constitutional body is to rule on a last-ditch effort by opposition lawmakers to thwart President Emmanuel Macron’s move to raise the retirement age to 64, through a possible referendum or new bill restoring the pension age to 62

title: In coronation, King Charles carries on a medieval tradition
description: Great Britain’s royal family turns the page on a new chapter with the coronation of King Charles III

title: Showtime! UK readies pomp for King Charles III's coronation
description: King Charles III will be crowned Saturday at Westminster Abbey in an event full of all the pageantry Britain can muster

title: Syrian refugees fearful as Lebanon steps up deportations
description: Lebanese officials have launched a crackdown on the country’s Syrian refugees against the backdrop of a worsening economic crisis and political stalemate

title: German police clamp down on Italian mob with raids, arrests
description: Police have arrested suspects and raided homes across Germany in a massive effort to clamp down on member of the Italian ’ndrangheta organized crime syndicate

title: Love, ambition, no politics: Chinese women flock to read Eileen Chang
description: Celebrated novelist Eileen Chang is enjoying a new surge in popularity in China, especially among young women looking to navigate social expectations.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Moscow seeks to replenish arms; E.U. to boost ammunition stock for Kyiv
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said Moscow has made improvements in repairing arms and military vehicles but wants to intensify such efforts.

title: The death toll in Ukraine is huge. It may still be far behind Tigray.
description: For all the weight of its brutality and violence, the war in Ukraine was not even the single deadliest conflict in the world last year.
